_header: In nomine patris god keep me & filii for charity
Subjects: manners, treatises on; servants, instructions to; courtesy books
_description: John Russell, ‘Boke of Kervyng & Nortur’ — 1250 lines in couplets

BLHar4011.First Lines:
In nomine patris god kepe me et filii for chariteEt spiritus sancti
                    Where that y goo by lond or els by see…
BLHar4011.Last Lines:
…Now good god graunt vs grace our sowles neuer to
                    Infecteþan may we regne in þi regioun eternally with thyme
                    electe
BLHar4011.Note:
Includes envoy of 16 lines in couplets; rubric ‘Amen’
                    follows last line of text before the envoy (f. 189).
BLHar4011.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.

Roxburghe Club
         87. Bungay: J. Childs and Son, 1867: 1-83.
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Babees Book, etc.
EETS
         o.s. 32 (1868); rev. ed.  Early English Meals and

Chetham8009.First Lines:
In nomine patris god kep me & filij for
                        CheriteEt spiritus sancti where I be both by lond & be
                    see…
Chetham8009.Last Lines:
…ffor his fadere and moders soule þat ye be prayingeTo
                    brynge vs to the blis þat never shall haue endynge Amen
Chetham8009.Note: 227 monorhyming quatrains; 2nd stanza has extra first line.
Chetham8009.Attributed Title:
A boke of kervyng And Nourtur (f. 336, centered on otherwise blank page); A
                    good boke of kervyng and Nortur (f. 337); Explicit the boke off nvrture
                    And of kervynge quod Ego (f. 355v)
